Happy 75th Birthday to Larry Dobbs. Larry conceived of an idea in the 1968 Maynard Jackson U.S. Senate campaign to unseat Herman Talmadge that Georgia could achieve a new Democratic majority by coordinating the black majority counties of Central Georgia, as well as turning out the black vote inside Metro-Atlanta. While the south was still in the throws of de-segregation, the strategy was unsuccessful, but that campaign led to Maynard Jackson's election as the first African-American Mayor of Atlanta. Today, the Tomlinson campaign picks up on the legacy of Larry Dobbs, Maynard Jackson, Andrew Young and others who foresaw a new Democratic future for today's world.  #HistoryMakers
